00040 // A C-program for MT19937, with initialization improved 2002/1/26.
00041 // Coded by Takuji Nishimura and Makoto Matsumoto.

00044 // or init_by_array(init_key, key_length).

00093     public class MersenneTwisterRandomSource :
00094         RandomSource
00095     {
00100         const int N = 624;
00101 
00106         const int M = 397;
00107 
00112         const uint VectorA = 0x9908b0dfU;
00113 
00118         const uint UpperMask = 0x80000000U;
00119 
00124         const uint LowerMask = 0x7fffffffU;
00125 
00130         const double IntToDoubleMultiplier = 1.0 / ((double)int.MaxValue + 1.0);
00131 
00136         const double UIntToDoubleMultiplier = 1.0 / ((double)uint.MaxValue + 1.0);
00137 
00141         uint[] _mt;
00142 
00146         uint _mti;
00147 
00151         uint _seed;
00152 
00156         uint[] _seedArray;
00157 
00161         uint _bitBuffer;
00162 
00166         int _bitCount;
00167 
00172         public
00173         MersenneTwisterRandomSource()
00174             : this((uint)Math.Abs(Environment.TickCount))
00175         {
00176         }
00177 
00185         public
00186         MersenneTwisterRandomSource(
00187             int seed
00188             )
00189             : this((uint)Math.Abs(seed))
00190         {
00191         }

00199         [CLSCompliant(false)]
00200         public
00201         MersenneTwisterRandomSource(
00202             uint seed
00203             )
00204         {
00205             _mt = new uint[N];
00206             _seed = seed;
00207             ResetGenerator();
00208         }
00209 
00220         public
00221         MersenneTwisterRandomSource(
00222             int[] seedArray
00223             )
00224         {
00225             if(seedArray == null)
00226             {
00227                 string message = string.Format(
00228                     Resources.ArgumentNull,
00229                     "seedArray"
00230                     );
00231 
00232                 throw new ArgumentNullException("seedArray", message);
00233             }
00234 
00235             _mt = new uint[N];
00236             _seed = 19650218U;
00237 
00238             _seedArray = new uint[seedArray.Length];
00239             for(int index = 0; index < seedArray.Length; index++)
00240             {
00241                 _seedArray[index] = (uint)Math.Abs(seedArray[index]);
00242             }
00243 
00244             ResetGenerator();
00245         }
00246 
00256         [CLSCompliant(false)]
00257         public
00258         MersenneTwisterRandomSource(
00259             uint[] seedArray
00260             )
00261         {
00262             if(seedArray == null)
00263             {
00264                 string message = string.Format(
00265                     Resources.ArgumentNull,
00266                     "seedArray"
00267                     );
00268 
00269                 throw new ArgumentNullException("seedArray", message);
00270             }
00271 
00272             _mt = new uint[N];
00273             _seed = 19650218U;
00274             _seedArray = seedArray;
00275             ResetGenerator();
00276         }
00277 
00282         void
00283         ResetGenerator()
00284         {
00285             _mt[0] = _seed & 0xffffffffU;
00286             for(_mti = 1; _mti < N; _mti++)
00287             {
00288                 _mt[_mti] = (1812433253U * (_mt[_mti - 1] ^ (_mt[_mti - 1] >> 30)) + _mti);
00289 
00290                 // See Knuth TAOCP Vol2. 3rd Ed. P.106 for multiplier.
00291                 // In the previous versions, MSBs of the seed affect only MSBs of the array mt[].
00292                 // 2002/01/09 modified by Makoto Matsumoto
00293             }
00294 
00295             // If the object was instantiated with a seed array do some further (re)initialisation.
00296             if(_seedArray != null)
00297             {
00298                 ResetBySeedArray();
00299             }
00300 
00301             // Reset helper variables used for generation of random booleans.
00302             _bitBuffer = 0;
00303             _bitCount = 32;
00304         }
00305 
00309         void
00310         ResetBySeedArray()
00311         {
00312             uint i = 1;
00313             uint j = 0;
00314             int k = (N > _seedArray.Length) ? N : _seedArray.Length;
00315             for(; k > 0; k--)
00316             {
00317                 _mt[i] = (_mt[i] ^ ((_mt[i - 1] ^ (_mt[i - 1] >> 30)) * 1664525U)) + _seedArray[j] + j; // non linear
00318                 i++;
00319                 j++;
00320 
00321                 if(i >= N)
00322                 {
00323                     _mt[0] = _mt[N - 1];
00324                     i = 1;
00325                 }
00326 
00327                 if(j >= _seedArray.Length)
00328                 {
00329                     j = 0;
00330                 }
00331             }
00332 
00333             for(k = N - 1; k > 0; k--)
00334             {
00335                 _mt[i] = (_mt[i] ^ ((_mt[i - 1] ^ (_mt[i - 1] >> 30)) * 1566083941U)) - i; // non linear
00336                 i++;
00337                 if(i >= N)
00338                 {
00339                     _mt[0] = _mt[N - 1];
00340                     i = 1;
00341                 }
00342             }
00343 
00344             _mt[0] = 0x80000000U; // MSB is 1; assuring non-0 initial array
00345         }
00346 
00354         void
00355         GenerateNUInts()
00356         {
00357             int kk;
00358             uint y;
00359             uint[] mag01 = new uint[2] { 0x0U, VectorA };
00360 
00361             for(kk = 0; kk < N - M; kk++)
00362             {
00363                 y = (_mt[kk] & UpperMask) | (_mt[kk + 1] & LowerMask);
00364                 _mt[kk] = _mt[kk + M] ^ (y >> 1) ^ mag01[y & 0x1U];
00365             }
00366 
00367             for(; kk < N - 1; kk++)
00368             {
00369                 y = (_mt[kk] & UpperMask) | (_mt[kk + 1] & LowerMask);
00370                 _mt[kk] = _mt[kk + (M - N)] ^ (y >> 1) ^ mag01[y & 0x1U];
00371             }
00372 
00373             y = (_mt[N - 1] & UpperMask) | (_mt[0] & LowerMask);
00374             _mt[N - 1] = _mt[M - 1] ^ (y >> 1) ^ mag01[y & 0x1U];
00375 
00376             _mti = 0;
00377         }
00378 
00386         [CLSCompliant(false)]
00387         public
00388         uint
00389         NextUInt()
00390         {
00391             if(_mti >= N)
00392             {
00393                 // generate N words at one time
00394                 GenerateNUInts();
00395             }
00396 
00397             uint y = _mt[_mti++];
00398 
00399             // Tempering
00400             y ^= (y >> 11);
00401             y ^= (y << 7) & 0x9d2c5680U;
00402             y ^= (y << 15) & 0xefc60000U;
00403             return (y ^ (y >> 18));
00404         }
00405 
00413         public
00414         int
00415         NextInclusiveMaxValue()
00416         {
00417             // Its faster to explicitly calculate the unsigned random number than simply call NextUInt().
00418             if(_mti >= N)
00419             {
00420                 // generate N words at one time
00421                 GenerateNUInts();
00422             }
00423 
00424             uint y = _mt[_mti++];
00425 
00426             // Tempering
00427             y ^= (y >> 11);
00428             y ^= (y << 7) & 0x9d2c5680U;
00429             y ^= (y << 15) & 0xefc60000U;
00430             y ^= (y >> 18);
00431 
00432             return (int)(y >> 1);
00433         }
00434 
00442         public override
00443         int
00444         Next()
00445         {
00446             // Its faster to explicitly calculate the unsigned random number than simply call NextUInt().
00447             if(_mti >= N)
00448             {
00449                 // generate N words at one time
00450                 GenerateNUInts();
00451             }
00452 
00453             uint y = _mt[_mti++];
00454 
00455             // Tempering
00456             y ^= (y >> 11);
00457             y ^= (y << 7) & 0x9d2c5680U;
00458             y ^= (y << 15) & 0xefc60000U;
00459             y ^= (y >> 18);
00460 
00461             int result = (int)(y >> 1);
00462 
00463             // Exclude Int32.MaxValue from the range of return values.
00464             if(result == Int32.MaxValue)
00465             {
00466                 return Next();
00467             }
00468             else
00469             {
00470                 return result;
00471             }
00472         }
00473 
00488         public override
00489         int
00490         Next(
00491             int maxValue
00492             )
00493         {
00494             if(maxValue < 0)
00495             {
00496                 string message = string.Format(
00497                     Resources.ArgumentOutOfRangeGreaterEqual,
00498                     "maxValue",
00499                     "0"
00500                     );
00501 
00502                 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException("maxValue", maxValue, message);
00503             }
00504 
00505             // Its faster to explicitly calculate the unsigned random number than simply call NextUInt().
00506             if(_mti >= N)
00507             {
00508                 // generate N words at one time
00509                 GenerateNUInts();
00510             }
00511 
00512             uint y = _mt[_mti++];
00513 
00514             // Tempering
00515             y ^= (y >> 11);
00516             y ^= (y << 7) & 0x9d2c5680U;
00517             y ^= (y << 15) & 0xefc60000U;
00518             y ^= (y >> 18);
00519 
00520             // The shift operation and extra int cast before the first multiplication give better performance.
00521             // See comment in NextDouble().
00522             return (int)((double)(int)(y >> 1) * IntToDoubleMultiplier * (double)maxValue);
00523         }
00524 
00544         public override
00545         int
00546         Next(
00547             int minValue,
00548             int maxValue
00549             )
00550         {
00551             if(minValue > maxValue)
00552             {
00553                 string message = string.Format(
00554                     Resources.ArgumentOutOfRangeGreaterEqual,
00555                     "maxValue",
00556                     "minValue"
00557                     );
00558 
00559                 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException("maxValue", maxValue, message);
00560             }
00561 
00562             // Its faster to explicitly calculate the unsigned random number than simply call NextUInt().
00563             if(_mti >= N)
00564             {
00565                 // generate N words at one time
00566                 GenerateNUInts();
00567             }
00568 
00569             uint y = _mt[_mti++];
00570 
00571             // Tempering
00572             y ^= (y >> 11);
00573             y ^= (y << 7) & 0x9d2c5680U;
00574             y ^= (y << 15) & 0xefc60000U;
00575             y ^= (y >> 18);
00576 
00577             int range = maxValue - minValue;
00578             if(range < 0)
00579             {
00580                 // The range is greater than Int32.MaxValue, so we have to use slower floating point arithmetic.
00581                 // Also all 32 random bits (uint) have to be used which again is slower (See comment in NextDouble()).
00582                 return minValue + (int)
00583                     ((double)y * UIntToDoubleMultiplier * ((double)maxValue - (double)minValue));
00584             }
00585             else
00586             {
00587                 // 31 random bits (int) will suffice which allows us to shift and cast to an int before the first multiplication and gain better performance.
00588                 // See comment in NextDouble().
00589                 return minValue + (int)((double)(int)(y >> 1) * IntToDoubleMultiplier * (double)range);
00590             }
00591         }
00592 
00600         public override
00601         double
00602         NextDouble()
00603         {
00604             // Its faster to explicitly calculate the unsigned random number than simply call NextUInt().
00605             if(_mti >= N)
00606             {
00607                 // generate N words at one time
00608                 GenerateNUInts();
00609             }
00610 
00611             uint y = _mt[_mti++];
00612 
00613             // Tempering
00614             y ^= (y >> 11);
00615             y ^= (y << 7) & 0x9d2c5680U;
00616             y ^= (y << 15) & 0xefc60000U;
00617             y ^= (y >> 18);
00618 
00619             // Here a ~2x speed improvement is gained by computing a value that can be cast to an int 
00620             //   before casting to a double to perform the multiplication.
00621             // Casting a double from an int is a lot faster than from an uint and the extra shift operation 
00622             //   and cast to an int are very fast (the allocated bits remain the same), so overall there's 
00623             //   a significant performance improvement.
00624             return (double)(int)(y >> 1) * IntToDoubleMultiplier;
00625         }
00626 
00641         public override
00642         double
00643         NextDouble(
00644             double maxValue
00645             )
00646         {
00647             if(maxValue < 0.0)
00648             {
00649                 string message = string.Format(
00650                     Resources.ArgumentOutOfRangeGreaterEqual,
00651                     "maxValue",
00652                     "0.0"
00653                     );
00654 
00655                 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException("maxValue", maxValue, message);
00656             }
00657 
00658             // Its faster to explicitly calculate the unsigned random number than simply call NextUInt().
00659             if(_mti >= N)
00660             {
00661                 // generate N words at one time
00662                 GenerateNUInts();
00663             }
00664 
00665             uint y = _mt[_mti++];
00666 
00667             // Tempering
00668             y ^= (y >> 11);
00669             y ^= (y << 7) & 0x9d2c5680U;
00670             y ^= (y << 15) & 0xefc60000U;
00671             y ^= (y >> 18);
00672 
00673             // The shift operation and extra int cast before the first multiplication give better performance.
00674             // See comment in NextDouble().
00675             return (double)(int)(y >> 1) * IntToDoubleMultiplier * maxValue;
00676         }

00705         public override
00706         double
00707         NextDouble(
00708             double minValue,
00709             double maxValue
00710             )
00711         {
00712             if(minValue > maxValue)
00713             {
00714                 string message = string.Format(
00715                     Resources.ArgumentOutOfRangeGreaterEqual,
00716                     "maxValue",
00717                     "minValue"
00718                     );
00719 
00720                 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException("maxValue", maxValue, message);
00721             }
00722 
00723             double range = maxValue - minValue;
00724 
00725             if(range == double.PositiveInfinity)
00726             {
00727                 string message = string.Format(
00728                     Resources.ArgumentRangeLessEqual,
00729                     "minValue",
00730                     "maxValue",
00731                     "Double.MaxValue"
00732                     );
00733 
00734                 throw new ArgumentException(message);
00735             }
00736 
00737             // Its faster to explicitly calculate the unsigned random number than simply call NextUInt().
00738             if(_mti >= N)
00739             {
00740                 // generate N words at one time
00741                 GenerateNUInts();
00742             }
00743 
00744             uint y = _mt[_mti++];
00745 
00746             // Tempering
00747             y ^= (y >> 11);
00748             y ^= (y << 7) & 0x9d2c5680U;
00749             y ^= (y << 15) & 0xefc60000U;
00750             y ^= (y >> 18);
00751 
00752             // The shift operation and extra int cast before the first multiplication give better performance.
00753             // See comment in NextDouble().
00754             return minValue + (double)(int)(y >> 1) * IntToDoubleMultiplier * range;
00755         }
00756 
00764         public override
00765         bool
00766         NextBoolean()
00767         {
00768             if(_bitCount == 32)
00769             {
00770                 // Generate 32 more bits (1 uint) and store it for future calls.
00771                 // Its faster to explicitly calculate the unsigned random number than simply call NextUInt().
00772                 if(_mti >= N)
00773                 {
00774                     // generate N words at one time
00775                     GenerateNUInts();
00776                 }
00777 
00778                 uint y = _mt[_mti++];
00779 
00780                 // Tempering
00781                 y ^= (y >> 11);
00782                 y ^= (y << 7) & 0x9d2c5680U;
00783                 y ^= (y << 15) & 0xefc60000U;
00784                 _bitBuffer = (y ^ (y >> 18));
00785 
00786                 // Reset the bitCount and use rightmost bit of buffer to generate random bool.
00787                 _bitCount = 1;
00788                 return (_bitBuffer & 0x1) == 1;
00789             }
00790 
00791             // Increase the bitCount and use rightmost bit of shifted buffer to generate random bool.
00792             _bitCount++;
00793             return ((_bitBuffer >>= 1) & 0x1) == 1;
00794         }
00795 
00807         public override
00808         void
00809         NextBytes(
00810             byte[] buffer
00811             )
00812         {
00813             if(buffer == null)
00814             {
00815                 string message = string.Format(
00816                     Resources.ArgumentNull,
00817                     "buffer"
00818                     );
00819 
00820                 throw new ArgumentNullException("buffer", message);
00821             }
00822 
00823             // Fill the buffer with 4 bytes (1 uint) at a time.
00824             int i = 0;
00825             uint y;
00826             while(i < buffer.Length - 3)
00827             {
00828                 // Its faster to explicitly calculate the unsigned random number than simply call NextUInt().
00829                 if(_mti >= N)
00830                 {
00831                     // generate N words at one time
00832                     GenerateNUInts();
00833                 }
00834 
00835                 y = _mt[_mti++];
00836 
00837                 // Tempering
00838                 y ^= (y >> 11);
00839                 y ^= (y << 7) & 0x9d2c5680U;
00840                 y ^= (y << 15) & 0xefc60000U;
00841                 y ^= (y >> 18);
00842 
00843                 buffer[i++] = (byte)y;
00844                 buffer[i++] = (byte)(y >> 8);
00845                 buffer[i++] = (byte)(y >> 16);
00846                 buffer[i++] = (byte)(y >> 24);
00847             }
00848 
00849             // Fill up any remaining bytes in the buffer.
00850             if(i < buffer.Length)
00851             {
00852                 // Its faster to explicitly calculate the unsigned random number than simply call NextUInt().
00853                 if(_mti >= N)
00854                 {
00855                     // generate N words at one time
00856                     GenerateNUInts();
00857                 }
00858 
00859                 y = _mt[_mti++];
00860 
00861                 // Tempering
00862                 y ^= (y >> 11);
00863                 y ^= (y << 7) & 0x9d2c5680U;
00864                 y ^= (y << 15) & 0xefc60000U;
00865                 y ^= (y >> 18);
00866 
00867                 buffer[i++] = (byte)y;
00868                 if(i < buffer.Length)
00869                 {
00870                     buffer[i++] = (byte)(y >> 8);
00871                     if(i < buffer.Length)
00872                     {
00873                         buffer[i++] = (byte)(y >> 16);
00874                         if(i < buffer.Length)
00875                         {
00876                             buffer[i] = (byte)(y >> 24);
00877                         }
00878                     }
00879                 }
00880             }
00881         }
00882 
00886         public override
00887         void
00888         Reset()
00889         {
00890             ResetGenerator();
00891         }
00892 
00897         public override bool CanReset
00898         {
00899             get { return true; }
00900         }
00901     }
